de.mrapp.android.dialog.animation

Class DialogAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.animation.DialogAnimation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleRevealAnimation, FadeAnimation, RectangleRevealAnimation

    public abstract class DialogAnimation
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class for all animations, which can be used to show or hide a dialog.
    Since:
    4.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  DialogAnimation.AbstractDialogAnimationBuilder<AnimationType extends DialogAnimation,BuilderType extends DialogAnimation.AbstractDialogAnimationBuilder<AnimationType,?>>
      An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create animations, which can be used to show or hide a dialog.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DialogAnimation(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new animation, which can be used to show or hide a dialog.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogAnimation

        protected DialogAnimation(@NonNull
                          android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new animation, which can be used to show or hide a dialog.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the animation, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • setInterpolator

        protected final void setInterpolator(@NonNull
                                     android.view.animation.Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets the interpolator, which should be used by the animation.
        Parameters:
        interpolator - The interpolator, which should be set, as an instance of the type Interpolator. The interpolator may not be null

      • setDuration

        protected final void setDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration of the animation.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration, which should be set, in milliseconds as a Long value. The duration must be at least 1

      • setStartDelay

        protected final void setStartDelay(long startDelay)
        Sets the delay until the animation is started.
        Parameters:
        startDelay - The delay, which should be set, in milliseconds as a Long value. The delay must be at least 0

      • setAlpha

        protected final void setAlpha(float alpha)
        Sets the alpha, which should be used by the animation.
        Parameters:
        alpha - The alpha, which should be set, as a Float value. The alpha must be at least 0 and at maximum 1

      • getInterpolator

        @NonNull
public final android.view.animation.Interpolator getInterpolator()
        Returns the interpolator, which is used by the animation.
        Returns:
        The interpolator, which is used by the animation, as an instance of the type Interpolator. The interpolator may not be null

      • getDuration

        public final long getDuration()
        Returns the duration of the animation.
        Returns:
        The duration of the animation in milliseconds as a Long value

      • getStartDelay

        public final long getStartDelay()
        Returns the delay until the animation is started.
        Returns:
        The delay until the animation is started in milliseconds as a Long value

      • getAlpha

        public final java.lang.Float getAlpha()
        Returns the alpha, which is used by the animation.
        Returns:
        The alpha, which is used by the animation as a Float value, or null, if no alpha is used
